clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy of Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation to Attenuate Muscle Loss
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy of Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation to Attenuate Skeletal Muscle Loss in ICU Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Subjects who are hospitalized in the ICU will be included after 24 hours of intubation during their ICU stay. Twice-daily Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation (NMES) will be performed on one leg for 2x40 min per day to assess muscle fiber size. The investigators hypothesize an attenuated loss in muscle fiber size.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in muscle fiber cross sectional area (CSA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours before and 12 hours after 10 days of twice-daily NMES
primary_outcome.description: Muscle fiber cross sectional area (in um2) for type I and II fibers will be analyzed by using immunohistochemistry; the change of muscle fiber CSA over time will be measured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours before and 12 hours after 10 days of twice-daily NMES
secondary_outcome.description: Upper leg circumgerence will be measured; the change of upper leg circumference over time will be measured

arm_group.description: The 'NMES' arm will be treated with NMES.
The 'No NMES' arm of the experiment will be sham-treated with NMES. The device will be installed, but not used.

intervention.intervention_name: Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation of m. quadriceps femoris
intervention.description: Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation of m. quadriceps femoris by using a commercially available muscle stimulator

intervention.other_name: No electrical stimulation; the leg will be sham-treated

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male
- Age between 18 and 80 years
- Expected sedated time of >24h
Exclusion Criteria:
- Spinal Cord Injury
- Arterial operaties on the legs
- Local wounds that prohibit NMES
- Chronic use of corticosteroids
- Intake of certain antithrombotic drugs
- Presence of implantable cardioverter defibrillator and/or pacemaker
